article:
'Calcium' is the chemical element with symbol 'Ca' and atomic
number 20. Calcium is a soft gray alkaline earth metal, and is the fifth-most-
abundant element by mass in the Earth's crust. Calcium is also the fifth-most-
abundant dissolved ion in seawater by both molarity and mass, after sodium,
chloride, magnesium, and sulfate.

Calcium is essential for living organisms, in particular in cell physiology,
where movement of the calcium ion Ca 2+ into and out of the cytoplasm
functions as a signal for many cellular processes. As a major material used in
mineralization of bone, teeth and shells, calcium is the most abundant metal by
mass in many animals.
